mobs.LongDesc: A pile of wood lit on fire flies around this area.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This looks exactly like a pile of wood lit on fire in the shape of what
you know of as a fly.  It is flying around being rather annoying.

mobs.LongDesc: A small-winged cat screeches and circles above you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The wings are hawk-like, with brown feathers, and the tail matches the wings.
But the head and legs are definitely that of the cat kingdom, and it has
sharp white teeth and claws.

mobs.LongDesc: There is a book here, inching its way along the ground.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Looking more closely at the book, you notice that it has a head similar to
that of a worm...strange...

mobs.LongDesc: Stanley Steamer, the infamous Gap Dragon, drools hungrily as you enter.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This is the most enormous animal you have ever seen in your entire life. He
dominates the area, his six mighty legs as thick as tree trunks, and tipped
with claws that are fully six inches long. His fanged mouth is truly awful,
and you quake in your boots as you contemplate his immensity. The steam
gushing from his mouth is fully as hot as any fire you might encounter, and
just as deadly. You'd better run away while you still can!

mobs.LongDesc: A huge and terrible tangle tree prepares to devour you!
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This tree looks like nothing more than a huge weeping willow, with thick and
flexible tentacular branches. The trunk opens into a huge mouth, with sap
dripping from it like saliva. The whole effect is horrifying, and you feel
as if you must run now, or be devoured!

mobs.LongDesc: A small, whitish worm "zzzap!"s its way ominously in your direction.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Wiggles are memebers of the vole family, the original tunneling creatures.
They are tiny, nearly mindless, and live only to burrow their way through
anything in their path...including you!

mobs.LongDesc: A large dragon with black smoke belching from its mouth slavers at you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This dragon is about average size, as dragons go. Some say that smoke dragons
are even more dangerous than fire dragons, because that smoke can suffocate
you very quickly. Also, the two are sometimes found together.

mobs.LongDesc: A small flying dragon puffs fire from its nostrils and swoops down on you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This dragon is made for strafing runs, all of its muscle goes to either the
wings or the chest. Speed and firepower are its specialties, as you are just
about to discover...

mobs.LongDesc: There is a ram here trying to batter it way through a wall.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This sheep has small, curly horns and a curly pelt.  It seems to
enjoy running into any obstacle in its path trying to crash through
it.

mobs.LongDesc: A huge and incredibly ugly ogre glowers at you stupidly.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Ogres from Xanth are about 12 feet tall and immensely strong. Their strength
is directly proportional to their ugliness, and inversely proportional to
their intelligence. This one looks VERY ugly and VERY stupid, so you'd
better watch out...

mobs.LongDesc: A fish with a shiny halo over its head swims here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This small fish glows lightly, a halo shines over its head and you could
swear those fins look an awful lot like wings.  This is the strangest looking
fish you've ever seen... perhaps it won't be for long though, this is Xanth
after all.

mobs.LongDesc: An ant with the head of a lion is crawling around here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This small insect has the body of an ant and the maned head of
a lion.  It looks as though it could be a very powerful fighter,
and the legs and jaws are strong enough and pointed enough to
cause damage through armor.  There is also a stinger at the
end of their abdomen.

mobs.LongDesc: A four-footed, cow type creature with hooves and horns is here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This bum steer looks around wondering where all his cigarettes went,
and when you ask where the North Village is, he points off to the
south and asks "Got a smoke?  Come on man, just gimme a smoke, huh?"
You shake your head at the obvious wrong answer to the question, and
don't bother answering his question.

mobs.LongDesc: A cat with nine long tails sits here cleaning itself.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
As you look closer to this creature, you realize why you weren't
sure if it was a normal cat.  It LOOKS like a normal cat, but it
has nine tails where there should be only one.  It notices you 
looking at it and hisses at you, putting it's ears back against 
its head.

mobs.LongDesc: There is a cat with a striped green and brown coat sitting here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
You look closer at the cat and notice that its "fur" is actually
composed of needles instead of fur.  The ears are actually thorns
that are large and stiff.  The claws of the cat area actually sharpened
slicing blades of bone.  It blinks as you look at it.

mobs.LongDesc: There is a reddish fish with horns glanceing around here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
You look closer at the fish and figure by it's color and it's 
horns, it must be a Devilfish.  You think about everything you 
know about the Devilfish and realize that it's probably looking
for an angel fish to <censored> her.  The barbed tail on the
back of the fish looks like a dangerous weapon.

mobs.LongDesc: You see a gleam of metal and notice a copper-headed snake ready to strike.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
You look closer at the snake and are almost blinded by the glare
off from the snake's copper head.  As it opens it's mouth wide to 
strike at you, you notice even it's fangs and tongue are copper...

mobs.LongDesc: There is a four legged, antlered fly here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
As you look closer at this creature it lifts its head at looks at
you with big, soulful, brown eyes.  You notice how soft the fur is 
on they fly and think that it could be easy to kill, but then
you notice the deadly hooves and think it might not be THAT easy
to kill after all.

mobs.LongDesc: A golden eagle with two heads sits perched on a branch here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
As you look closer at the monster you notice that the wings glisten
a goldish color.  The beaks are sharp and ready to kill if need be
and the talons are sharp enough to rip through any armor like a can
opener.

mobs.LongDesc: There is a very small dragon buzzing around your head.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This dragon looks like a miniature of it's large cousin.  It is
a Dragonfly, you assume.  It preys on bugs and occasionally keeps
a garden free of pests.  Basically, it's harmless, IF you don't
annoy it.

mobs.LongDesc: There is a LARGE bird laying on a nest here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
As you look closer to this bird, you realize that it must
be the mythical Phoenix.  The immortal bird that rises from
he ashes of it's own corpse.  The beauty of the bird is amazing.
The feathers on the wings look glossed over.  You would swear
this was a statue, if it wasn't moving.

mobs.LongDesc: You smell an enormous invisible giant, the stench is incredibly offal.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
You can't see this giant, but you can't miss the smell.
Plants are withering in the area as you watch, and bugs and 
animals are dropping like flies. Your eyes are watering from the
aroma and you are suffering from the urge to RUN!!!

mobs.LongDesc: You see a cute little bunny here with blood dripping from its three-inch fangs.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This bunny looks innocent enough from a few feet away, but as you get closer,
you notice that it has huge fangs, and is slavering at you hungrily. It must
be a fabled carnivorous rabiit, very deadly to the incautious.

mobs.LongDesc: A creature with the heads of a lion, a goat, and a dragon lurks here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The chimera is an ancient heraldic beast, very dangerous. It has three heads,
a lion's head, a goat's heat, and a dragon's head. Its claws are also very
dangerous, and the dragon's head can breathe fire. You are in for a tough
fight, if you decide to stick around long enough.

mobs.LongDesc: A man with the head of a horned bovine gazes at you placidly.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Cowboys are peaceful herbivores, and ordinarily do not molest travelers.
However, they will fight fiercely if provoked, or to defend their cowgirls.
They are known to be pretty tough, and their horns are wickedly sharp. You
would probably do well to leave this one be.

mobs.LongDesc: A small, dangerous looking insect is here with picers about the size of a nickel.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This little creature is about 4 inches long with 500 legs and magical
pincers that can gouge out circles of flesh called nickels.  It is
made of a silvery metal, and doesn't look very dangerous by itself.
However, this insect, which you have figured out is a nickelpede, never
comes alone, no doubt there are more where it came from.  Together they
can swarm over a centaur or any other powerful creature given a little
time.  It would be best to go back before it's buddies come.

mobs.LongDesc: The Good Magician's guardian and doorkeeper squints at you suspiciously.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This guardian is a normal-looking human, probably another person with a
Question for the Magician. He doesn't appear particularly unfriendly, but
he is not about to let you pass, either. Looks like you will just have
to persuade him otherwise...

mobs.LongDesc: A small, dangerous looking insect is here with pincers about the size of a dime.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This little creature is about 3 inches long with 500 legs and magical
pincers that can gouge out circles of flesh called dimes.  It is
made of a silvery metal, and doesn't look very dangerous by itself.
However, this insect, which you have figured out is a dimepede, never
comes alone, no doubt there are more where it came from.  Together they
can swarm over a centaur or any other powerful creature given a little
time.  It would be best to go back before it's buddies come.
Dimepede cut out pieces of flesh smaller than nickelpedes, but they
hurt twice as much, so be careful or you'll be nickel and dimed to death.

mobs.LongDesc: A small, dangerous looking insect is here with dual pincers about the size of a quarter.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This little creature is about 6 inches long with 500 legs and magical
pincers that can gouge out circles of flesh called quarters.  Quarterpedes
are much more feared than either dimepedes or nickelpedes because they
can gouge out two bits at a time, making them much more dangerous.
Quarterpedes are about 5 times as big as nickelpedes and quite dangerous
Looking at it, you can see it is probably about to attack you.

mobs.LongDesc: A huge cat with a strange looking tail stares back at you and purrs.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This is the biggest cat you have ever seen.  It is about 10 feet tall at the
shoulder and has a huge tail.  The tail ends in a strange cup shape.  As you
walk closer the tail goes from being straight up in the air back to parallel
to the ground with an audible *click*. The cat points to the sign.

mobs.LongDesc: A large male sheep with steam puffing from its ears lowers its head and charges!
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This is a hydraulic ram, related to the battering ram, but bigger, stronger,
and stupider, if possible. Hydraulic rams are usually ornery, and ready to
bash their heads into anything they encounter. In this case, that's you.

mobs.LongDesc: There is a mob here
mobs.DetailedDesc: This looks like your perfectly buffed 25th level mob.
